title: Ancient Underworld Gate Adventure #55
goal: Solve the puzzles, achieve the main objective, and escape.

rooms.name: Entrance Chamber of the Underworld
rooms.description: A dark stone chamber carved deep beneath the earth. Ancient Greek columns support a vaulted ceiling covered in faded frescoes depicting souls crossing the River Styx. The air is cold and still, carrying the faint scent of sulfur. Torches flicker in iron sconces, casting dancing shadows on walls inscribed with warnings in ancient script. A heavy bronze door stands to the north.

items.name: stone pedestal
items.description: A weathered pedestal with carved reliefs of three-headed dogs and ferrymen

items.name: silver obol coin
items.description: An ancient Greek coin used to pay the ferryman of the dead

items.name: offering altar
items.description: A black marble altar with three compartments for offerings to the underworld gods

items.name: scroll of the underworld
items.description: A papyrus scroll with faded Greek writing
items.text: The Underworld Codex: Three heads guard the gate, three judges weigh the souls, three paths lead to different fates. Remember the sacred number: 333. The ferryman Charon demands payment. The three-headed guardian Cerberus allows none to leave. Lord Hades rules all.

items.name: ancient bronze key
items.description: A heavy bronze key with the symbol of Hades engraved upon it

items.name: sealed stone chest
items.description: A chest carved from black stone with bronze fittings and a keyhole

items.name: map of the underworld
items.description: A detailed map showing the realms of the dead
items.text: Map of the Underworld: The River Styx flows through all realms. Charon the ferryman transports souls across the water. Beyond the Hall of Trials lies the Gate itself, guarded by mighty Cerberus. Only those who answer the Three Questions may pass.

items.name: ceremonial dagger
items.description: A bronze dagger used in ancient underworld rituals

items.name: warning inscription
items.description: Ancient Greek text carved into the stone wall
items.text: WARNING TO ALL WHO ENTER: This is the realm of Hades, Lord of the Dead. Charon ferries souls across the Styx. Cerberus guards the gate with three heads. Pay the ferryman, answer the questions, and you may yet escape.

items.name: heavy bronze door
items.description: A massive door decorated with scenes of the underworld, leading north to the Hall of Trials

rooms.name: Hall of Trials
rooms.description: A vast columned hall with statues of underworld deities lining both sides. The floor is polished black marble reflecting the torchlight. At the center, three stone thrones sit empty - the seats of the judges of the dead. Frescoes on the ceiling depict Hades and Persephone ruling their dark kingdom. An imposing gate carved with fearsome imagery stands at the far end.

items.name: statue of Hades
items.description: A towering statue of the Lord of the Underworld holding a scepter
items.text: Inscription: 'Hades, Lord of the Dead, Ruler of the Underworld. He who judges all souls and commands the shadows. His word is law in this realm.'

items.name: statue of Persephone
items.description: An elegant statue of the Queen of the Underworld holding pomegranate seeds
items.text: Inscription: 'Persephone, Queen of the Underworld, who dwells six months below and six months above. She brings mercy to the realm of shadows.'

items.name: statue of Charon
items.description: A weathered statue of the ferryman with his pole and boat
items.text: Inscription: 'Charon, Ferryman of the Dead. He transports souls across the River Styx for payment of one obol. Without his service, none may cross the waters of death.'

items.name: statue of Cerberus
items.description: A fearsome statue depicting the three-headed hound of Hades
items.text: Inscription: 'Cerberus, Guardian of the Gate. The three-headed hound who allows all to enter but none to leave. He is the final barrier between the living and the dead.'

items.name: three stone thrones
items.description: The seats where Minos, Rhadamanthus, and Aeacus judge the souls of the dead

items.name: tablet of judgment
items.description: A stone tablet with the criteria for judging souls
items.text: The Three Questions of Passage: To pass through the Gate of the Underworld, you must prove your knowledge. Who guards the gate? Who ferries souls across the Styx? Who rules this realm of shadows?

items.name: ceremonial offering bowl
items.description: A bronze bowl containing ancient coins and offerings

items.name: golden key of passage
items.description: A key made of gold with intricate underworld symbols

items.name: ceiling fresco
items.description: A magnificent painting showing Hades and Persephone on their thrones
items.text: The fresco depicts Hades, Lord of the Underworld, seated beside Persephone. Around them, souls are judged and ferried by Charon across the dark waters. Cerberus stands guard at the gate, his three heads ever watchful.

items.name: gate of the underworld
items.description: A massive iron gate decorated with images of Cerberus and souls. Three questions are inscribed in ancient Greek on a bronze plaque.

password_questions.question: Who guards the gate?
password_questions.hint: Check the statues and inscriptions about the three-headed guardian

password_questions.question: Who ferries souls across the Styx?
password_questions.hint: The map and statues mention the ferryman who requires payment

password_questions.question: Who rules the underworld?
password_questions.hint: Multiple inscriptions and the fresco identify the Lord of the Dead

rooms.name: Chamber of the Ancient Gate
rooms.description: You have reached the Chamber of the Ancient Gate! A colossal stone archway dominates the room, covered in glowing runes that pulse with otherworldly energy. Beyond the arch, you can see a shimmering portal leading back to the world of the living. The three-headed shadow of Cerberus watches but does not attack - you have proven yourself worthy. Fresh air flows through the portal, carrying the scent of the surface world.

items.name: ancient gate archway
items.description: A massive stone arch covered in mystical runes, the true gate between worlds

items.name: shimmering portal
items.description: A swirling portal of light leading back to the world above
items.text: The portal shimmers with golden light, offering passage back to the realm of the living. You have solved the mysteries of the underworld and earned your escape.

items.name: shadow of Cerberus
items.description: The spectral form of the three-headed guardian, watching but allowing passage

items.name: inscription of passage
items.description: Words carved into the arch itself
items.text: You who have answered the Three Questions and proven your knowledge of the underworld may pass. Go forth, and remember what you have learned in the realm of shadows.

rooms.win_message: You step through the shimmering portal and feel the warmth of sunlight on your face! You have successfully navigated the Ancient Underworld Gate, solved its mysteries, and escaped the realm of the dead. The knowledge of Hades, Charon, and Cerberus has served you well. As the portal closes behind you, you stand once more in the world of the living, forever changed by your journey. You win!
